TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DocumentDesigner extends System.Windows.Forms.Design.ScrollableControlDesigner implements class System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesigner, class System.ComponentModel.Design.IRootDesigner, class System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxUser, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: Base designer class for extending the design mode behavior of, and providing a root-level design mode view for, a that supports nested controls and should receive scroll messages.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This designer is a root designer, meaning that it provides the root-level design mode view for the associated document when it is viewed in design mode.
You can associate a designer with a type using a <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignerAttribute>. For an overview of customizing design time behavior, see [Extending Design-Time Support](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void Dispose(bool disposing) cil managed

Docs.param: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.
Docs.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is called by the public `Dispose()`method and the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method. `Dispose()` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`. <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes `Dispose` with `disposing` set to `false`.
When the `disposing` parameter is true, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.DocumentDesigner> references. This method invokes the `Dispose()` method of each referenced object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance bool GetToolSupported(class System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem tool) cil managed

Docs.param: The to test for toolbox support.
Docs.summary: Indicates whether the specified tool is supported by the designer.
Docs.returns: if the tool should be enabled on the toolbox; if the document designer doesn't know how to use the tool.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If a tool is supported, it will be enabled in the toolbox when the designer receives focus. Otherwise, it will be disabled. Once a tool is marked as enabled or disabled it can not be queried again.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void PreFilterProperties(class System.Collections.IDictionary properties) cil managed

Docs.param: An <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> that contains the properties for the class of the component.
Docs.summary: Adjusts the set of properties the component exposes through a .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerFilter> interface method override adds a set of properties to this designer's component at design time. This method adds the following browsable properties: "Location", and "BackColor".
## Remarks This method returns a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.SelectionRules> that prevents the document from being resized.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void ToolPicked(class System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem tool) cil managed

Docs.param: The to create a component for.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxUser.ToolPicked%2A> is called when the user double-clicks on a toolbox item. The document designer should create a component for the specified tool. Only tools that are enabled in the toolbox will be passed to this method.
